overview:
Gustavo Monteiro is founder and Chief Executive Officer of Opara. Opara is an online platform to increases control and traceability of perishable produce, in real time.

Gustavo is an undergraduate student of Computer Science. He is a self taught professional having 7 years experience in computer security industry. By the age of 22, he founded and managed the Security Operations Center in market leader company delivering differentiated services to high profile customers. Even without degree, he was invited to teach as a guest professor on the Network Security post graduation program on Santa Maria College.

By the age of 24, he decided to left his comfort zone. Willing to face new challenges as a entrepreneur, he started Opara with his colleague Felipe.

Gustavo is also a judoka. Judo can be compared to a small tree in a hurricane. When the brutal winds blow, the lithe tree’s branches sway and bend, and the tree survives. A bigger, stronger tree, unable to adapt to the gusts, is snapped or blown out of the ground. Similarly in judo, use of skill and speed can win out over brute force, and a smaller opponent can prevail through quickness, cunning and superior technique.
